Literature Review: Reciprocal constructions are a complex phenomenon in linguistics, involving the mapping of semantics onto morphosyntax. This complexity challenges the standard processes relating predicates to situations, and thus languages arrive at a great diversity of solutions for how reciprocal situations are encoded within a single clausal structure. In this literature review, we will explore the typology of reciprocal constructions, examining the morphosyntactic and semantic properties that interact and the implicational connections and correlations with other parts of the linguistic system.
